title: 7.1 Description of Quicksort
content:
Section 7.1

Description of Quicksort

Summary

Divide-and-conquer sorting: partition around a pivot, recursively sort partitions.

Key Points

  • PARTITION: rearrange so elements < pivot are left, > pivot are right
  • Pivot ends up in its final sorted position
  • Recursively sort left and right partitions
  • Average: O(n log n), Worst: O(n²)

Pseudocode

QUICKSORT(A, p, r):
    if p < r:
        q = PARTITION(A, p, r)
        QUICKSORT(A, p, q-1)
        QUICKSORT(A, q+1, r)

PARTITION(A, p, r):
    x = A[r]  # pivot
    i = p - 1
    for j = p to r-1:
        if A[j] ≤ x:
            i = i + 1
            swap A[i] and A[j]
    swap A[i+1] and A[r]
    return i + 1

Why It Matters

Fastest practical sorting algorithm for most data.
